content.text:
# Draft:AG5 Skills Management Software

AG5 is a Dutch software company headquartered in Amsterdam, Netherlands. The company develops plug-and-play skills management software aimed at helping organisations track, manage, and visualise workforce competencies in real time. AG5 positions its services as a replacement for traditional Excel-based matrices in manufacturing, logistics, and safety-critical industries.
History
AG5 was founded in 2019 by brothers Rick and Mathieu van Echtelt, along with Wouter Gazendam. The founders identified a gap in how companies manage workforce competencies and compliance, particularly in shift-based or regulated environments.
The platform was designed to reduce reliance on spreadsheets for tracking employee certifications and improve visibility across operational teams.
In March 2023, AG5 raised €6 million in a seed funding round led by Headline, Peak, and Acadian Ventures to scale its product and expand into additional international markets.
Products and Services
AG5 provides a cloud-based skills management platform used to build dynamic skill matrices, track training needs, and manage compliance data. Features include:
* Integration with HR and learning management systems (LMS)
* Real-time dashboards for team and role-based skills coverage
* Automatic notifications for expiring certifications
* Skills gap analysis and audit-readiness tools
The software is used by companies in industries such as manufacturing, aviation, logistics, and healthcare.
Funding
Seed round: €6 million in March 2023, led by Headline, Peak, and Acadian Ventures
